posts.content:
On the 14th December I made a change to the configuration of the forums that altered the way cookies are set. This may prevent some people logging in. The first thing to do is to delete your browser cookies that are associated with the forum. You can do that by clicking here

Alternatively (but not as easy) try the information on this site:
http://www.aboutcookies.org/Default.aspx?page=2

Sorry for the inconvenience this may cause but it's an essential step to make way for some new features coming to the site later this year.

If the problem isn't down to the change here is some more suggestions.....

There are a number of reasons why you may have trouble logging in.
Some of these include:

1) Cookie problems.

To delete your forum cookies please click here: here


2) email address change
Have you changed the email address associated with your forum account? If so you will be temporarily locked out of the forum. Please mail the forum admins to get your account reactivated (address ssvcforum AT ssvc DOT org DOT uk).

3) User error.
Make sure you type your password in correctly and with the same case (make sure you don't have Caps Lock on). If you think you may be using the wrong password, try the forgotten password link:
http://www.ssvc.org.uk/phpbb/profile.ph ... ndpassword

4) Google Web Accelerator or similar product.
We have had a user have problems caused by Google Web Accelerator. There is a known problem with the accelerator that impacts phpbb forum users. Other similar products may have similar problems.

5)Using the incorrect forum address to login with.
Make sure your login page has the www.ssvc.org.uk address (not the old ssvc.ukshells.co.uk address)

If you're an Internet Explorer user it may also be worth trying another browser such as Firefox ( http://www.mozilla.com/en-US/ ) to see if you have the same problems.

If you are still having problems just drop a mail to the forum admins:
ssvcforum AT ssvc DOT org DOT uk. In the mail please could you give the following information:
    Username
    Internet service provider
    Browser used (Internet Explorer, Firefox, Safari etc.)
    Any add on tool bars installed in the browser
    What error messages fo you get?
    Have you checked the 5 points above?


Cheers,

John

Quote:
Sorry for the inconvenience this may cause but it's an essential step to make way for some new features coming to the site later this year.

So whats new Doc?

BROOKSY wrote:
Quote:
Sorry for the inconvenience this may cause but it's an essential step to make way for some new features coming to the site later this year.

So whats new Doc?


Shouldn't that have been "What's up Doc?"

Secret, I'd have to shoot you if I told you
right...so now i am having to log on everytime i visit the forum??? ie my remember me(log on auto every time you visit) aint working??? any tips please gizmo???

nick wrote:
right...so now i am having to log on everytime i visit the forum??? ie my remember me(log on auto every time you visit) aint working??? any tips please gizmo???

Nick, take a look here:
http://www.ssvc.org.uk/phpbb/viewtopic.php?t=37169
basically all you need to do is click here:
http://www.ssvc.org.uk/phpbb/cookiedelete.php
and all your problems should be sorted (well, all problems to do with posting and logging on here, it won't do your Christmas shopping for you)
John
nope i did all that and it still asks me to log on every time i visit..

nick wrote:
nope i did all that and it still asks me to log on every time i visit..


Are you using the proper address ( www.ssvc.org.uk ) or the old temporary one (ssvc.ukshells.co.uk). If you are till having problems after deleting the cookies my guess is you are using the ukshells address (I may be wrong though).

http://www.ssvc.org.uk/phpbb/viewtopic.php?t=31925

Doc wrote:
nick wrote:
nope i did all that and it still asks me to log on every time i visit..


Are you using the proper address ( www.ssvc.org.uk ) or the old temporary one (ssvc.ukshells.co.uk). If you are till having problems after deleting the cookies my guess is you are using the ukshells address (I may be wrong though).

http://www.ssvc.org.uk/phpbb/viewtopic.php?t=31925



hi doc...no i am using the correct one and also noticed that new posts are not highlighted once i do log on...this is on my home pc and my works one also...so i am guessing the fault is the server end somewhere...

nick wrote:
Doc wrote:
nick wrote:
nope i did all that and it still asks me to log on every time i visit..


Are you using the proper address ( www.ssvc.org.uk ) or the old temporary one (ssvc.ukshells.co.uk). If you are till having problems after deleting the cookies my guess is you are using the ukshells address (I may be wrong though).

http://www.ssvc.org.uk/phpbb/viewtopic.php?t=31925



hi doc...no i am using the correct one and also noticed that new posts are not highlighted once i do log on...this is on my home pc and my works one also...so i am guessing the fault is the server end somewhere...


I doubt it's a server side issue.

OK...
-you've deleted your cookies using the cookie deleter
-you're using the correct address

Have you got Google Web Accelerator installed? This is know to make phpBB forums problematic for users who have installed it. I've had one guy with issues before, uninstalling it fixed the problem.

If you haven't got it installed, what browser are you using? Do you have any other kinds of accelerator software installed?

John

hi doc, i use internet explorer, i dont know what you mean Accelerator installed? and as i said this is happening on 2 different pc's that i have never had a problem with before...i still have to log on every visit and after logging on the new posts are not highlighted???
i dont know what else to do?? i have read and followed all the links possable.....
sorry to be a pain. i am on other foroums which are the same layout as this one and dont have the fault i am getting here...
sorry doc i think ive sorted it...but i had to delete all history and temp files????

nope same again!!!!
fed up now.....

nick wrote:
nope same again!!!!
fed up now.....

hmmm.
Do you have access to another browser just to give it a go on the same connection? (Firefox may be? http://www.mozilla.com/products/downloa ... lang=en-GB )
The cookie delete link ( http://www.ssvc.org.uk/phpbb/cookiedelete.php ) should have sorted it without the need to delete all your temp and history files. Have you done the cooie delete on both PCs?

The accelerator I mentioned is from Google ( http://webaccelerator.google.com/ ), it causes problems for phpbb.

Sorry for the inconvenience on this one. If you are still having problems tomorrow I can reset your password and log on as you and have a quick test.
nick-EXACTLY the same problems as me.
